clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Local Warming in Children Venipuncture
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Local Warming in Children to Facilitate Venipuncture. A Randomized Controlled Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to determine if local application of heat increases the probability of insertion of peripheral venous catheter at the first attempt, reduces the time needed to obtain cannulation and maintains the analgesic effect of Emla in children undergoing peripheral venous cannulation and previously treated with local analgesia with Emla.

primary_outcome.measure: rate of success of peripheral venous cannulation at the first attempt
primary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome is observed and recorded immediatly after the venous cannulation. No follow up is required

secondary_outcome.measure: pain perceived by the child undergone to the cannulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome is observed and recorded immediatly after the venous cannulation. No follow up is required
secondary_outcome.description: The pain level is estimated using a visual analog scale (from 0 to 10) or the Wong "faces'" Scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Difficulty in performing cannulation perceived by Nurse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome is observed and recorded immediatly after the venous cannulation. No follow up is required
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome is calculated using an "ad hoc" Visual Analog Scale (from 0 to 10)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From positioning tourniquet to completion of cannulation. No follow up is required

arm_group.description: Children in this arm will receive standard preparation of the venipuncture site (local analgesia with Emla) without warming
Children in this arm will receive standard preparation of the venipuncture site (local analgesia with Emla) plus warming with a heating pad at 40째C for 5 minutes

intervention.description: In this arm Emla is applied 60 minutes before the procedure and then the site of venepuncture is warmed by an electric heating sand pad at the temperature of 40째C for 5 minutes before performing cannulation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age between 8 and 13 years
- Intravenous drug therapy prescribed by a physician
- no allergy to lidocaine
- no local skin disease
- absence of burns scars
- child and his/her family are native speaker of Italian
- BMI not lower than 10째 centile for sex and age according to the CDC standards
Exclusion Criteria:
- age of child not included in the age range established for the study
- Intravenous drug therapy not needed
- Presence of an allergy to lidocaine products
- Skin disease
- Presence of burns scars
- The child or his/her family are not native speaker Italian
- BMI lower than 10째 centile according to the CDC standards
